resources.string: Please Select A Date and Time :
Please Select the Date and Time!!

1. Check the National Blood Centre site to register, ensure you meet the criteria and know the nearest blood donation site to you. 

2. Be well rested with at least five hours of sleep. 

3. Stay hydrated by drinking at least eight glasses of water a day. 

4. If you are a former Covid-19 patient, you will only be allowed to donate blood 14 days after recovery. 

5. Vaccine recipients without adverse events following immunisation (AEFI) may donate blood seven days after their vaccination appointment. Those who experience AEFI can donate after seven days of recovery.

1. Have a meal four hours before your appointment. 

2. Wear comfortable clothing. For those wearing long sleeves, ensure they can be folded up until the upper part of your arm. 

3. Bring along your identity card, driver’s licence or passport for registration and identification purposes. 

4. Drink enough water while waiting your turn to donate blood. You will have your finger pricked to test your blood group and hemoglobin levels. 

5. Any questions can be directed to a healthcare professional during your consultation session before the donation. The actual blood drawing process will only take up to 10 minutes.
On the Day of your Donation:
Press Yes to Submit the Appointment Form
